unittitle.value: Jules Kirsch Collection on Art Young

abstract.value: Jules P. Kirsch is a New York-based attorney. He was a member of the Lawyers' Constitutional Defense Committee in the 1960s, focusing on civil rights efforts. This collection consists of materials created and collected by Kirsch concerning cartoonist Art Young, including correspondence between Kirsch and photographer Berenice Abbot and a photographic print of Young.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Jules Kirsch Collection on Art Young; TAM 787; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Jules Kirsch in December 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.062.
Jules P. Kirsch is a New York-based attorney. He was a member of the Lawyers' Constitutional Defense Committee in the 1960s, focusing on civil rights efforts.

This collection consists of materials created and collected by Jules Kirsch concerning cartoonist Art Young, including correspondence between Kirsch and photographer Berenice Abbot and a photographic print of Young.
